agent=Multi-Domain Information Organizer
2024-07-06 17:02:15: task=You are given a tool that retrieves info simply by asking questions as a list of strings. Use the tool to extract comprehensive personal details.
How you should use the tool: argument: "question": "Give me Personal Details about the applicant"
The tool will return a large chunk of information. look "deeply" into the chunk to find your data. If you did not find a field, ask the tool again with the missing field. for example, if you didn't find the GitHub, ask the tool "Do the applicant have GitHub?" to get the GitHub link.
This is what the GitHub profile link looks like: https://github.com/username This is what the GitHub repository link looks like: https://github.com/username/repository_name
If you find the GitHub repository link, simply remove the repository name from the link to make it a GitHub profile link as it will contain the "username". Use that as the GitHub link.

There may be multiple degrees or educational experiences to consider.
**How to Use the Tool:** - Start by querying the tool with a broad question to gather a complete overview of the Applicant's educational background. If initial results are missing specific details, refine your queries to target these areas.
**Initial Query:** - "question": "What are all the educational qualifications, academic degrees, and related honors or distinctions obtained by the Applicant?"
**Refined Query (if needed):** - If the initial query does not return complete details (such as the name of the institution, degree specifics, GPA, etc.), run additional targeted queries for each missing element. For example:
  - "question": "What is the GPA and graduation year for the Applicant's Bachelor degree?"
  - "question": "List any academic honors or distinctions received by the Applicant during their university education."

For the "Honors/Distinctions" field, Do not get confused with non-academic honors like "Employee of the Month" or "Best Team Player". Only include academic honors like "Summa Cum Laude" or "Dean's List" if available.

# Personal Details
This section contains the contact information of the Applicant.

```
name: Saif Mahmud
saifmahmud.dev | linkedin.com/in/vmsaif
msaifofficial@gmail.com | 204 955 5064 | Winnipeg, MB
```

A unique self-made philosophy has always guided my journey in software development: to
create a "magic button" for users. That is, One button should do everything the user wants at this moment. Though this is not possible yet given our technological limitations, I have always believed, that programs should be as simple as that. 

This concept is not just about simplifying interactions but
about deeply understanding the user's needs and crafting solutions that feel intuitive,
empowering, and, above all, magical. It's about creating experiences where complex processes
vanish behind a single, seamless action. One button that will do everything the user is thinking
at the moment. Though this is not possible yet, I have written every single code line while
keeping this philosophy in my mind.

## ATS Pass AI 
Multiagent | AI | Python | RAG Search | Resume Automation Tool - January 2024 - Present

- Utilized advanced AI models and multi-agent technologies to dynamically personalize resumes, demonstrating cutting-edge technical and analytical capabilities.
- Engineered a system that extracts user data and analyzes job descriptions with advanced AI tools like Gemini Pro and RAG Search, achieving over 85% keyword alignment and optimizing resumes for ATS.
- Developed scalable architecture to anticipate future needs and adaptations, showcasing foresight and a commitment to innovation.
- Project repository available on GitHub: [https://github.com/vmsaif/ats-pass-ai](https://github.com/vmsaif/ats-pass-ai).

agent=Cross-Match Evaluator with Job Description
2024-07-06 17:04:54: task=Analyze and compare the keywords from a job description (Source 1) to the skills listed in the applicant's profile (Source 2). Ensure that partial matches are functionally or contextually related to the job requirements.
**Task Instructions**:
1. **Sources for Comparison**:
   - **Source 1**: Job Description Keywords.
   - **Source 2**: A JSON Object "combined skills list of applicant" containing the applicant's skills and technologies.

2. **Use of Tool**: It will search the internet. Use the tool to search for unfamiliar skills or technologies to understand their relevance to the job description.
  - Example of an unfamiliar skill: "Langchain". To use the tool,
  query: str = Field(description="What is Langchain, what is it's comparable tools, technology?")
  
3. **Evaluation Criteria**:
    - **Exact Match**: Direct correspondence between the job description and the applicantâ€™s qualifications. 
    
    - **Partial Match**: Skills that are not exactly the same but share similar applications or functionalities as those required by the job. The Job Description Section contains a "Partial_Match" field. Try to match the applicant's skills with the job description's Partial_Match field 
    
    - **missing_from_the_applicant_skills**: Skills that do not align with the job description. Your goal should be to move as many skills as possible from this section to the "Partial Match" after researching their relevance by using the tool. 

   The partial match section has 2 fields per object: 
    - "Skill Name": The skill mentioned in the job description.
    - "Relevance": The relevance of the applicant's with the job description's skill.

4. **Categorization**:
   - Organize skills into categories such as Programming Languages, Soft Skills, AI Frameworks, etc., based on the job description's requirements. Feel free to create category names as you see fit.

   - Aim for a balanced overview by listing 3-5 skills combining exact and partial matches for all categories.

5. **Structured Report**:
   - Generate a JSON report with 'Exact Match' and 'Partial Match' sections, specifying the job-related skill and its relevance to the applicant's skills.

Job Description Starts:
## Robinhood Software Developer - Reliability: Keyword and Phrase Extraction for Resume Optimization

**Introduction:**

* **Role:** Software Developer - Reliability
* **Company:** Robinhood
* **Location:** Toronto, ON
* **Industry:** Fintech, Financial Services, Technology 

**Company Culture & Values:**

Robinhood is seeking **curious, growth-minded thinkers** who are passionate about **democratizing finance for all**.  They value **collaboration, innovation,** and a **customer-centric** approach. Candidates should be **mission-driven** and eager to contribute to a company experiencing rapid growth and focused on building an **inclusive and welcoming environment**. 

**What Robinhood is Looking For:**

Robinhood seeks a Software Developer with a strong background in building and maintaining **large-scale distributed systems**.  Ideal candidates will have experience with **high availability, low latency** systems, and be proficient in languages like **Python and Go.** Familiarity with **AWS cloud technologies** and tools like **Kubernetes, Kafka, and microservice architectures** is highly desirable.

**What the Candidate Can Expect:**

As part of the Reliability Engineering team, the candidate will play a crucial role in **designing, evolving, and maintaining critical systems**. This includes building a company-wide outage tracking system and monitoring key workflows for reliability.  The role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology in a **fast-paced, collaborative environment**.

**Keyword Categorization:**

**Essential Skills:**

* **Hard Skills:**  Software Development, Distributed Systems, High Availability, Low Latency, Scalability, Cloud Computing (AWS),  Python, Go, Kubernetes, Kafka, Microservices, CI/CD, Automation, Observability
* **Soft Skills:** Collaboration, Communication, Problem-Solving,  Growth Mindset, Ownership, Leadership

**Industry Terms:**

* Fintech, Financial Services,  Outage Tracking,  Workflow Monitoring,  SEV (Severity Event),  Reliability Engineering

**Company Values & Culture:**

* Democratizing Finance,  Curiosity, Growth-Minded,  Collaboration, Innovation, Customer-Centric, Mission-Driven, Inclusivity

**Action Verbs:**

* Design, Implement, Optimize, Improve, Ensure, Act, Lead, Collaborate, Build, Maintain, Track, Monitor, Identify, Remediate 

**Prioritization and Relevance:**

* **Frequency and Emphasis:**  Distributed Systems, High Availability, Low Latency, Scalability,  Python, Go, AWS, Kubernetes 
* **Essential vs. Preferred Qualifications:** Experience with Python/Django/Go and AWS are listed as "pluses", indicating they are preferred but not mandatory.  

**Resume Optimization Tip:**

Use the extracted keywords and phrases naturally throughout your resume, focusing on your accomplishments and quantifiable results. Highlight your experience with the specific technologies and methodologies mentioned in the job description to demonstrate your suitability for the role.

agent=Experience Selector2024-07-06 17:06:12: task=Select the top 2 relevant experiences from the applicant's work and project history based on the provided job description. Evaluate experiences ensuring relevance and recency, without favoring work over project types.
**Selection Criteria**:
1. **Most Recent Experience:** Always include the most recent relevant experience, unless it is completely unrelated or significantly outdated as of today (July 06, 2024). 2. **Relevance to Job Description:** Thoroughly assess each experience based on:
  - **Keywords and Phrases:** Ensure experiences include specific keywords or phrases from the job description.
  - **Tools and Technologies:** Look for experiences that directly involve the tools and technologies listed in the job description.
  - **Skills:** Choose experiences that demonstrate the skills explicitly required for the job.
3. **Balanced Selection:** After including the most recent experience, select two additional experiences that best meet the job requirements. Aim to maintain a balance between work and project experiences, based solely on relevance.

Applicant Info Organized Data:
# Personal Details
This section contains the contact information of the Applicant.

```
name: Saif Mahmud
saifmahmud.dev | linkedin.com/in/vmsaif
msaifofficial@gmail.com | 204 955 5064 | Winnipeg, MB
```

A unique self-made philosophy has always guided my journey in software development: to
create a "magic button" for users. That is, One button should do everything the user wants at this moment. Though this is not possible yet given our technological limitations, I have always believed, that programs should be as simple as that. 

This concept is not just about simplifying interactions but
about deeply understanding the user's needs and crafting solutions that feel intuitive,
empowering, and, above all, magical. It's about creating experiences where complex processes
vanish behind a single, seamless action. One button that will do everything the user is thinking
at the moment. Though this is not possible yet, I have written every single code line while
keeping this philosophy in my mind.

# Education 
This section contains the educational qualifications of the Applicant. It lists the degrees obtained and the institutions attended. 

## University of Manitoba
BSc Major in Computer Science
Graduated, October 2023 | GPA: 3.07

## Relevant Courses
This section contains the relevant courses taken by the Applicant. 

- Distributed Computing (Python | JavaScript)
- Data Structures and Algorithms (Java)
- Object Orientation (Java | C++)
- Software Engineering (Java | Unit Testing)
- Database Implementation (SQL | Python)
- AI and Game Development (Java | Python)
- Technical Communication in CS

# Skills

**Guidelines:**
  - **Relevance:** Integrate keywords that are relevant to the described experience.
  - **Natural Language:** Weave keywords into the narrative seamlessly; they should enhance rather than disrupt the flow.
  - **Conciseness and Clarity:** 
    -- Limit the short description to 10-15 words, focusing on a concise summary of the experience. Make sure it is not redundant with the key highlights below.
    -- Employ powerful action verbs and succinct phrases to convey significant achievements in approximately 10-20 words per key highlight. If possible, split one entry into multiple key highlights to keep them concise.
  - **Contextual Accuracy:** Choose keywords that accurately reflect the skills and responsibilities in the experience. Avoid using keywords that misrepresent the applicant's role or contributions.
  - you are also provided a list of "missing_from_the_applicant_skills" which are in the job description but not in the applicant's experiences. Try to weave some of these words where they fit naturally.
  - **Avoid Keyword Overload:** Maintain a balanced use of keywords to ensure natural readability and effectiveness of the description.

**Job Description Keywords:** ## Robinhood Software Developer - Reliability: Keyword and Phrase Extraction for Resume Optimization

**Introduction:**

* **Role:** Software Developer - Reliability
* **Company:** Robinhood
* **Location:** Toronto, ON
* **Industry:** Fintech, Financial Services, Technology 

**Company Culture & Values:**

Robinhood is seeking **curious, growth-minded thinkers** who are passionate about **democratizing finance for all**.  They value **collaboration, innovation,** and a **customer-centric** approach. Candidates should be **mission-driven** and eager to contribute to a company experiencing rapid growth and focused on building an **inclusive and welcoming environment**. 

**What Robinhood is Looking For:**

Robinhood seeks a Software Developer with a strong background in building and maintaining **large-scale distributed systems**.  Ideal candidates will have experience with **high availability, low latency** systems, and be proficient in languages like **Python and Go.** Familiarity with **AWS cloud technologies** and tools like **Kubernetes, Kafka, and microservice architectures** is highly desirable.

**What the Candidate Can Expect:**

As part of the Reliability Engineering team, the candidate will play a crucial role in **designing, evolving, and maintaining critical systems**. This includes building a company-wide outage tracking system and monitoring key workflows for reliability.  The role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology in a **fast-paced, collaborative environment**.

**Keyword Categorization:**

**Essential Skills:**

* **Hard Skills:**  Software Development, Distributed Systems, High Availability, Low Latency, Scalability, Cloud Computing (AWS),  Python, Go, Kubernetes, Kafka, Microservices, CI/CD, Automation, Observability
* **Soft Skills:** Collaboration, Communication, Problem-Solving,  Growth Mindset, Ownership, Leadership

**Industry Terms:**

* Fintech, Financial Services,  Outage Tracking,  Workflow Monitoring,  SEV (Severity Event),  Reliability Engineering

**Company Values & Culture:**

* Democratizing Finance,  Curiosity, Growth-Minded,  Collaboration, Innovation, Customer-Centric, Mission-Driven, Inclusivity

**Action Verbs:**

* Design, Implement, Optimize, Improve, Ensure, Act, Lead, Collaborate, Build, Maintain, Track, Monitor, Identify, Remediate 

**Prioritization and Relevance:**

* **Frequency and Emphasis:**  Distributed Systems, High Availability, Low Latency, Scalability,  Python, Go, AWS, Kubernetes 
* **Essential vs. Preferred Qualifications:** Experience with Python/Django/Go and AWS are listed as "pluses", indicating they are preferred but not mandatory.  

**Resume Optimization Tip:**

Use the extracted keywords and phrases naturally throughout your resume, focusing on your accomplishments and quantifiable results. Highlight your experience with the specific technologies and methodologies mentioned in the job description to demonstrate your suitability for the role. 

**Missing from the Applicant's Skills:** Provided in the context.
Count the total number of experiences. After enhancing the descriptions, provide a detailed report that specifies the changes made, especially any keywords that were integrated.
When you are done with listing the experiences with integrated keywords, provide a detailed report on changes in a new section ## Report on Changes:
## Report on Changes in structure in JSON:
  - **Original Sentence**: Present the sentence before any updates.
  - **Revised Sentence**: Display the sentence after keywords have been integrated.
  - **Keywords Added**: List each keyword that was newly added, ensuring they were not present before.
  - **Rationale**: Provide a detailed explanation for each keyword addition, linking the choice to specific requirements or phrases in the job description.

**Introduction:**

* **Role:** Software Developer - Reliability
* **Company:** Robinhood
* **Location:** Toronto, ON
* **Industry:** Fintech, Financial Services, Technology

Candidates should be **mission-driven** and eager to contribute to a company experiencing rapid growth and focused on building an **inclusive and welcoming environment**.

Ideal candidates will have experience with **high availability, low latency** systems, and be proficient in languages like **Python and Go.** Familiarity with **AWS cloud technologies** and tools like **Kubernetes, Kafka, and microservice architectures** is highly desirable.

Robinhood, a leading fintech company, seeks a Software Developer - Reliability to join its team in Toronto. The ideal candidate will possess expertise in designing, developing, and maintaining large-scale distributed systems with a focus on high availability, low latency, and scalability.

agent=Cross-Match Evaluator with Job Description
2024-07-06 18:23:37: task=Analyze and compare the keywords from a job description (Source 1) to the skills listed in the applicant's profile (Source 2). Ensure that partial matches are functionally or contextually related to the job requirements.
**Task Instructions**:
1. **Sources for Comparison**:
   - **Source 1**: Job Description Keywords.
   - **Source 2**: A JSON Object "combined skills list of applicant" containing the applicant's skills and technologies.

2. **Use of Tool**: It will search the internet. Use the tool to search for unfamiliar skills or technologies to understand their relevance to the job description.
  - Example of an unfamiliar skill: "Langchain". To use the tool,
  query: str = Field(description="What is Langchain, what is it's comparable tools, technology?")
  
3. **Evaluation Criteria**:
    - **Exact Match**: Direct correspondence between the job description and the applicantâ€™s qualifications. 
    
    - **Partial Match**: Skills that are not exactly the same but share similar applications or functionalities as those required by the job. The Job Description Section contains a "Partial_Match" field. Try to match the applicant's skills with the job description's Partial_Match field 
    
    - **missing_from_the_applicant_skills**: Skills that do not align with the job description. Your goal should be to move as many skills as possible from this section to the "Partial Match" after researching their relevance by using the tool. 

   The partial match section has 2 fields per object: 
    - "Skill Name": The skill mentioned in the job description.
    - "Relevance": The relevance of the applicant's with the job description's skill.

4. **Categorization**:
   - Organize skills into categories such as Programming Languages, Soft Skills, AI Frameworks, etc., based on the job description's requirements. Feel free to create category names as you see fit.

   - Aim for a balanced overview by listing 3-5 skills combining exact and partial matches for all categories.

5. **Structured Report**:
   - Generate a JSON report with 'Exact Match' and 'Partial Match' sections, specifying the job-related skill and its relevance to the applicant's skills.

Job Description Starts:
## Robinhood Software Developer - Reliability: Keyword and Phrase Extraction for Resume Optimization

**Introduction:**

* **Role:** Software Developer - Reliability
* **Company:** Robinhood
* **Location:** Toronto, ON
* **Industry:** Fintech, Financial Services, Technology 

**Company Culture & Values:**

Robinhood is seeking **curious, growth-minded thinkers** who are passionate about **democratizing finance for all**.  They value **collaboration, innovation,** and a **customer-centric** approach. Candidates should be **mission-driven** and eager to contribute to a company experiencing rapid growth and focused on building an **inclusive and welcoming environment**. 

**What Robinhood is Looking For:**

Robinhood seeks a Software Developer with a strong background in building and maintaining **large-scale distributed systems**.  Ideal candidates will have experience with **high availability, low latency** systems, and be proficient in languages like **Python and Go.** Familiarity with **AWS cloud technologies** and tools like **Kubernetes, Kafka, and microservice architectures** is highly desirable.

**What the Candidate Can Expect:**

As part of the Reliability Engineering team, the candidate will play a crucial role in **designing, evolving, and maintaining critical systems**. This includes building a company-wide outage tracking system and monitoring key workflows for reliability.  The role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology in a **fast-paced, collaborative environment**.

**Keyword Categorization:**

**Essential Skills:**

* **Hard Skills:**  Software Development, Distributed Systems, High Availability, Low Latency, Scalability, Cloud Computing (AWS),  Python, Go, Kubernetes, Kafka, Microservices, CI/CD, Automation, Observability
* **Soft Skills:** Collaboration, Communication, Problem-Solving,  Growth Mindset, Ownership, Leadership

**Industry Terms:**

* Fintech, Financial Services,  Outage Tracking,  Workflow Monitoring,  SEV (Severity Event),  Reliability Engineering

**Company Values & Culture:**

* Democratizing Finance,  Curiosity, Growth-Minded,  Collaboration, Innovation, Customer-Centric, Mission-Driven, Inclusivity

**Action Verbs:**

* Design, Implement, Optimize, Improve, Ensure, Act, Lead, Collaborate, Build, Maintain, Track, Monitor, Identify, Remediate 

**Prioritization and Relevance:**

* **Frequency and Emphasis:**  Distributed Systems, High Availability, Low Latency, Scalability,  Python, Go, AWS, Kubernetes 
* **Essential vs. Preferred Qualifications:** Experience with Python/Django/Go and AWS are listed as "pluses", indicating they are preferred but not mandatory.  

**Resume Optimization Tip:**

Use the extracted keywords and phrases naturally throughout your resume, focusing on your accomplishments and quantifiable results. Highlight your experience with the specific technologies and methodologies mentioned in the job description to demonstrate your suitability for the role.

**Instructions**: - Review each skill provided in the list to determine if it is accurately categorized. Use the web search tool to research unfamiliar skills or to verify the appropriateness of the category they are placed in.

  To use the web search tool, 
    query: str = Field(description="search query to look up")

- Categorize skills based on their primary application and industry relevance. If a skill does not fit any existing category, create a new one. - Merge similar categories if they are overly specific or have overlapping skills to simplify the structure.

agent=Experience Selector2024-07-06 18:24:35: task=Select the top 2 relevant experiences from the applicant's work and project history based on the provided job description. Evaluate experiences ensuring relevance and recency, without favoring work over project types.
**Selection Criteria**:
1. **Most Recent Experience:** Always include the most recent relevant experience, unless it is completely unrelated or significantly outdated as of today (July 06, 2024). 2. **Relevance to Job Description:** Thoroughly assess each experience based on:
  - **Keywords and Phrases:** Ensure experiences include specific keywords or phrases from the job description.
  - **Tools and Technologies:** Look for experiences that directly involve the tools and technologies listed in the job description.
  - **Skills:** Choose experiences that demonstrate the skills explicitly required for the job.
3. **Balanced Selection:** After including the most recent experience, select two additional experiences that best meet the job requirements. Aim to maintain a balance between work and project experiences, based solely on relevance.
**Input:** - **Job Description Keywords:** ## Robinhood Software Developer - Reliability: Keyword and Phrase Extraction for Resume Optimization

**Introduction:**

* **Role:** Software Developer - Reliability
* **Company:** Robinhood
* **Location:** Toronto, ON
* **Industry:** Fintech, Financial Services, Technology 

**Company Culture & Values:**

Robinhood is seeking **curious, growth-minded thinkers** who are passionate about **democratizing finance for all**.  They value **collaboration, innovation,** and a **customer-centric** approach. Candidates should be **mission-driven** and eager to contribute to a company experiencing rapid growth and focused on building an **inclusive and welcoming environment**. 

**What Robinhood is Looking For:**

Robinhood seeks a Software Developer with a strong background in building and maintaining **large-scale distributed systems**.  Ideal candidates will have experience with **high availability, low latency** systems, and be proficient in languages like **Python and Go.** Familiarity with **AWS cloud technologies** and tools like **Kubernetes, Kafka, and microservice architectures** is highly desirable.

**What the Candidate Can Expect:**

As part of the Reliability Engineering team, the candidate will play a crucial role in **designing, evolving, and maintaining critical systems**. This includes building a company-wide outage tracking system and monitoring key workflows for reliability.  The role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology in a **fast-paced, collaborative environment**.

**Keyword Categorization:**

**Essential Skills:**

* **Hard Skills:**  Software Development, Distributed Systems, High Availability, Low Latency, Scalability, Cloud Computing (AWS),  Python, Go, Kubernetes, Kafka, Microservices, CI/CD, Automation, Observability
* **Soft Skills:** Collaboration, Communication, Problem-Solving,  Growth Mindset, Ownership, Leadership

**Industry Terms:**

* Fintech, Financial Services,  Outage Tracking,  Workflow Monitoring,  SEV (Severity Event),  Reliability Engineering

**Company Values & Culture:**

* Democratizing Finance,  Curiosity, Growth-Minded,  Collaboration, Innovation, Customer-Centric, Mission-Driven, Inclusivity

**Action Verbs:**

* Design, Implement, Optimize, Improve, Ensure, Act, Lead, Collaborate, Build, Maintain, Track, Monitor, Identify, Remediate 

**Prioritization and Relevance:**

* **Frequency and Emphasis:**  Distributed Systems, High Availability, Low Latency, Scalability,  Python, Go, AWS, Kubernetes 
* **Essential vs. Preferred Qualifications:** Experience with Python/Django/Go and AWS are listed as "pluses", indicating they are preferred but not mandatory.  

**Resume Optimization Tip:**

Use the extracted keywords and phrases naturally throughout your resume, focusing on your accomplishments and quantifiable results. Highlight your experience with the specific technologies and methodologies mentioned in the job description to demonstrate your suitability for the role.

# Personal Details
This section contains the contact information of the Applicant.

```
name: Saif Mahmud
saifmahmud.dev | linkedin.com/in/vmsaif
msaifofficial@gmail.com | 204 955 5064 | Winnipeg, MB
```

A unique self-made philosophy has always guided my journey in software development: to
create a "magic button" for users. That is, One button should do everything the user wants at this moment. Though this is not possible yet given our technological limitations, I have always believed, that programs should be as simple as that. 

This concept is not just about simplifying interactions but
about deeply understanding the user's needs and crafting solutions that feel intuitive,
empowering, and, above all, magical. It's about creating experiences where complex processes
vanish behind a single, seamless action. One button that will do everything the user is thinking
at the moment. Though this is not possible yet, I have written every single code line while
keeping this philosophy in my mind.

2024-07-06 18:24:53: task=Enhance the descriptions of the applicant's experiences by integrating key job description keywords to make them more appealing to Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) while ensuring they remain readable and relevant.
**Guidelines:**
  - **Relevance:** Integrate keywords that are relevant to the described experience.
  - **Natural Language:** Weave keywords into the narrative seamlessly; they should enhance rather than disrupt the flow.
  - **Conciseness and Clarity:** 
    -- Limit the short description to 10-15 words, focusing on a concise summary of the experience. Make sure it is not redundant with the key highlights below.
    -- Keep up-to 3 best key highlights for each experience, focusing on the most impactful achievements or skills.
    -- Employ powerful action verbs and succinct phrases to convey significant achievements in approximately 10-20 words per key highlight. If possible, split one entry into multiple key highlights to keep them concise.
  - **Contextual Accuracy:** Choose keywords that accurately reflect the skills and responsibilities in the experience. Avoid using keywords that misrepresent the applicant's role or contributions.
  - you are also provided a list of "missing_from_the_applicant_skills" which are in the job description but not in the applicant's experiences. Try to weave some of these words where they fit naturally.
  - **Avoid Keyword Overload:** Maintain a balanced use of keywords to ensure natural readability and effectiveness of the description.

**Job Description Keywords:** ## Robinhood Software Developer - Reliability: Keyword and Phrase Extraction for Resume Optimization

**Introduction:**

* **Role:** Software Developer - Reliability
* **Company:** Robinhood
* **Location:** Toronto, ON
* **Industry:** Fintech, Financial Services, Technology 

**Company Culture & Values:**

Robinhood is seeking **curious, growth-minded thinkers** who are passionate about **democratizing finance for all**.  They value **collaboration, innovation,** and a **customer-centric** approach. Candidates should be **mission-driven** and eager to contribute to a company experiencing rapid growth and focused on building an **inclusive and welcoming environment**. 

**What Robinhood is Looking For:**

Robinhood seeks a Software Developer with a strong background in building and maintaining **large-scale distributed systems**.  Ideal candidates will have experience with **high availability, low latency** systems, and be proficient in languages like **Python and Go.** Familiarity with **AWS cloud technologies** and tools like **Kubernetes, Kafka, and microservice architectures** is highly desirable.

**What the Candidate Can Expect:**

As part of the Reliability Engineering team, the candidate will play a crucial role in **designing, evolving, and maintaining critical systems**. This includes building a company-wide outage tracking system and monitoring key workflows for reliability.  The role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology in a **fast-paced, collaborative environment**.

**Keyword Categorization:**

**Essential Skills:**

* **Hard Skills:**  Software Development, Distributed Systems, High Availability, Low Latency, Scalability, Cloud Computing (AWS),  Python, Go, Kubernetes, Kafka, Microservices, CI/CD, Automation, Observability
* **Soft Skills:** Collaboration, Communication, Problem-Solving,  Growth Mindset, Ownership, Leadership

**Industry Terms:**

* Fintech, Financial Services,  Outage Tracking,  Workflow Monitoring,  SEV (Severity Event),  Reliability Engineering

**Company Values & Culture:**

* Democratizing Finance,  Curiosity, Growth-Minded,  Collaboration, Innovation, Customer-Centric, Mission-Driven, Inclusivity

**Action Verbs:**

* Design, Implement, Optimize, Improve, Ensure, Act, Lead, Collaborate, Build, Maintain, Track, Monitor, Identify, Remediate 

**Prioritization and Relevance:**

* **Frequency and Emphasis:**  Distributed Systems, High Availability, Low Latency, Scalability,  Python, Go, AWS, Kubernetes 
* **Essential vs. Preferred Qualifications:** Experience with Python/Django/Go and AWS are listed as "pluses", indicating they are preferred but not mandatory.  

**Resume Optimization Tip:**

Use the extracted keywords and phrases naturally throughout your resume, focusing on your accomplishments and quantifiable results. Highlight your experience with the specific technologies and methodologies mentioned in the job description to demonstrate your suitability for the role. 

**Missing from the Applicant's Skills:** Provided in the context.

When you are done with listing the experiences with integrated keywords, provide a detailed report on changes in a new section ## Report on Changes:
## Report on Changes in structure in JSON:
  - **Original Sentence**: Present the sentence before any updates.
  - **Revised Sentence**: Display the sentence after keywords have been integrated.
  - **Keywords Added**: List each keyword that was newly added, ensuring they were not present before.
  - **Rationale**: Provide a detailed explanation for each keyword addition, linking the choice to specific requirements or phrases in the job description.

2024-07-07 09:12:42: task=The task involves extracting detailed information about the applicant's work experiences, including work titles, durations, team sizes, roles, technologies used, and outcomes. Use the tool to extract this information from the applicant's input.
# Personal Details
This section contains the contact information of the Applicant.

```
name: Saif Mahmud
saifmahmud.dev | linkedin.com/in/vmsaif
msaifofficial@gmail.com | 204 955 5064 | Winnipeg, MB
```

A unique self-made philosophy has always guided my journey in software development: to
create a "magic button" for users. That is, One button should do everything the user wants at this moment. Though this is not possible yet given our technological limitations, I have always believed, that programs should be as simple as that. 

This concept is not just about simplifying interactions but
about deeply understanding the user's needs and crafting solutions that feel intuitive,
empowering, and, above all, magical. It's about creating experiences where complex processes
vanish behind a single, seamless action. One button that will do everything the user is thinking
at the moment. Though this is not possible yet, I have written every single code line while
keeping this philosophy in my mind.

## ATS Pass AI 
Multiagent | AI | Python | RAG Search | Resume Automation Tool - January 2024 - Present
- Led the development of a multi-agent system with CrewAI, LangChain, Gemini, and RAG Search to create tailored resumes to enhance job search efficiency.
- Utilized advanced AI models and multi-agent technologies to dynamically personalize resumes, demonstrating cutting-edge technical and analytical capabilities.
- Engineered a system that extracts user data and analyzes job descriptions with advanced AI tools like Gemini Pro and RAG Search, achieving over 85% keyword alignment and optimizing resumes for ATS.
- Developed scalable architecture to anticipate future needs and adaptations, showcasing foresight and a commitment to innovation.
- Project repository available on GitHub: [https://github.com/vmsaif/ats-pass-ai](https://github.com/vmsaif/ats-pass-ai).

name: Saif Mahmud

msaifofficial@gmail.com | 204 955 5064 | Winnipeg, MB
```

A unique self-made philosophy has always guided my journey in software development: to
create a "magic button" for users. That is, One button should do everything the user wants at this moment. Though this is not possible yet given our technological limitations, I have always believed, that programs should be as simple as that. 

This concept is not just about simplifying interactions but
about deeply understanding the user's needs and crafting solutions that feel intuitive,
empowering, and, above all, magical. It's about creating experiences where complex processes
vanish behind a single, seamless action. One button that will do everything the user is thinking
at the moment. Though this is not possible yet, I have written every single code line while
keeping this philosophy in my mind.

agent=Cross-Match Evaluator with Job Description
2024-07-07 09:14:25: task=Analyze and compare the keywords from a job description (Source 1) to the skills listed in the applicant's profile (Source 2). Ensure that partial matches are functionally or contextually related to the job requirements.
**Task Instructions**:
1. **Sources for Comparison**:
   - **Source 1**: Job Description Keywords.
   - **Source 2**: A JSON Object "combined skills list of applicant" containing the applicant's skills and technologies.

2. **Use of Tool**: It will search the internet. Use the tool to search for unfamiliar skills or technologies to understand their relevance to the job description.
  - Example of an unfamiliar skill: "Langchain". To use the tool,
  query: str = Field(description="What is Langchain, what is it's comparable tools, technology?")
  
3. **Evaluation Criteria**:
    - **Exact Match**: Direct correspondence between the job description and the applicantâ€™s qualifications. 
    
    - **Partial Match**: Skills that are not exactly the same but share similar applications or functionalities as those required by the job. The Job Description Section contains a "Partial_Match" field. Try to match the applicant's skills with the job description's Partial_Match field 
    
    - **missing_from_the_applicant_skills**: Skills that do not align with the job description. Your goal should be to move as many skills as possible from this section to the "Partial Match" after researching their relevance by using the tool. 

   The partial match section has 2 fields per object: 
    - "Skill Name": The skill mentioned in the job description.
    - "Relevance": The relevance of the applicant's with the job description's skill.

4. **Categorization**:
   - Organize skills into categories such as Programming Languages, Soft Skills, AI Frameworks, etc., based on the job description's requirements. Feel free to create category names as you see fit.

   - Aim for a balanced overview by listing 3-5 skills combining exact and partial matches for all categories.

5. **Structured Report**:
   - Generate a JSON report with 'Exact Match' and 'Partial Match' sections, specifying the job-related skill and its relevance to the applicant's skills.

Job Description Starts:
## Robinhood Software Developer - Reliability: Keyword and Phrase Extraction for Resume Optimization

**Introduction:**

* **Role:** Software Developer - Reliability
* **Company:** Robinhood
* **Location:** Toronto, ON
* **Industry:** Fintech, Financial Services, Technology 

**Company Culture & Values:**

Robinhood is seeking **curious, growth-minded thinkers** who are passionate about **democratizing finance for all**.  They value **collaboration, innovation,** and a **customer-centric** approach. Candidates should be **mission-driven** and eager to contribute to a company experiencing rapid growth and focused on building an **inclusive and welcoming environment**. 

**What Robinhood is Looking For:**

Robinhood seeks a Software Developer with a strong background in building and maintaining **large-scale distributed systems**.  Ideal candidates will have experience with **high availability, low latency** systems, and be proficient in languages like **Python and Go.** Familiarity with **AWS cloud technologies** and tools like **Kubernetes, Kafka, and microservice architectures** is highly desirable.

**What the Candidate Can Expect:**

As part of the Reliability Engineering team, the candidate will play a crucial role in **designing, evolving, and maintaining critical systems**. This includes building a company-wide outage tracking system and monitoring key workflows for reliability.  The role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology in a **fast-paced, collaborative environment**.

**Keyword Categorization:**

**Essential Skills:**

* **Hard Skills:**  Software Development, Distributed Systems, High Availability, Low Latency, Scalability, Cloud Computing (AWS),  Python, Go, Kubernetes, Kafka, Microservices, CI/CD, Automation, Observability
* **Soft Skills:** Collaboration, Communication, Problem-Solving,  Growth Mindset, Ownership, Leadership

**Industry Terms:**

* Fintech, Financial Services,  Outage Tracking,  Workflow Monitoring,  SEV (Severity Event),  Reliability Engineering

**Company Values & Culture:**

* Democratizing Finance,  Curiosity, Growth-Minded,  Collaboration, Innovation, Customer-Centric, Mission-Driven, Inclusivity

* Design, Implement, Optimize, Improve, Ensure, Act, Lead, Collaborate, Build, Maintain, Track, Monitor, Identify, Remediate

* **Frequency and Emphasis:**  Distributed Systems, High Availability, Low Latency, Scalability,  Python, Go, AWS, Kubernetes

# Personal Details
This section contains the contact information of the Applicant.

```
name: Saif Mahmud
saifmahmud.dev | linkedin.com/in/vmsaif
msaifofficial@gmail.com | 204 955 5064 | Winnipeg, MB
```

A unique self-made philosophy has always guided my journey in software development: to
create a "magic button" for users. That is, One button should do everything the user wants at this moment. Though this is not possible yet given our technological limitations, I have always believed, that programs should be as simple as that. 

This concept is not just about simplifying interactions but
about deeply understanding the user's needs and crafting solutions that feel intuitive,
empowering, and, above all, magical. It's about creating experiences where complex processes
vanish behind a single, seamless action. One button that will do everything the user is thinking
at the moment. Though this is not possible yet, I have written every single code line while
keeping this philosophy in my mind.

2024-07-07 09:15:44: task=Enhance the descriptions of the applicant's experiences by integrating key job description keywords to make them more appealing to Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) while ensuring they remain readable and relevant.
**Guidelines:**
  - **Relevance:** Integrate keywords that are relevant to the described experience.
  - **Natural Language:** Weave keywords into the narrative seamlessly; they should enhance rather than disrupt the flow.
  - **Conciseness and Clarity:** 
    -- Limit the short description to 10-15 words, focusing on a concise summary of the experience. Make sure it is not redundant with the key highlights below.
    -- Keep up-to 3 best key highlights for each experience, focusing on the most impactful achievements or skills.
    -- Employ powerful action verbs and succinct phrases to convey significant achievements in approximately 10-20 words per key highlight. If possible, split one entry into multiple key highlights to keep them concise.
  - **Contextual Accuracy:** Choose keywords that accurately reflect the skills and responsibilities in the experience. Avoid using keywords that misrepresent the applicant's role or contributions.
  - you are also provided a list of "missing_from_the_applicant_skills" which are in the job description but not in the applicant's experiences. Try to weave some of these words where they fit naturally.
  - **Avoid Keyword Overload:** Maintain a balanced use of keywords to ensure natural readability and effectiveness of the description.

**Job Description Keywords:** ## Robinhood Software Developer - Reliability: Keyword and Phrase Extraction for Resume Optimization

**Introduction:**

* **Role:** Software Developer - Reliability
* **Company:** Robinhood
* **Location:** Toronto, ON
* **Industry:** Fintech, Financial Services, Technology 

**Company Culture & Values:**

Robinhood is seeking **curious, growth-minded thinkers** who are passionate about **democratizing finance for all**.  They value **collaboration, innovation,** and a **customer-centric** approach. Candidates should be **mission-driven** and eager to contribute to a company experiencing rapid growth and focused on building an **inclusive and welcoming environment**. 

**What Robinhood is Looking For:**

Robinhood seeks a Software Developer with a strong background in building and maintaining **large-scale distributed systems**.  Ideal candidates will have experience with **high availability, low latency** systems, and be proficient in languages like **Python and Go.** Familiarity with **AWS cloud technologies** and tools like **Kubernetes, Kafka, and microservice architectures** is highly desirable.

**What the Candidate Can Expect:**

As part of the Reliability Engineering team, the candidate will play a crucial role in **designing, evolving, and maintaining critical systems**. This includes building a company-wide outage tracking system and monitoring key workflows for reliability.  The role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology in a **fast-paced, collaborative environment**.

**Keyword Categorization:**

**Essential Skills:**

* **Hard Skills:**  Software Development, Distributed Systems, High Availability, Low Latency, Scalability, Cloud Computing (AWS),  Python, Go, Kubernetes, Kafka, Microservices, CI/CD, Automation, Observability
* **Soft Skills:** Collaboration, Communication, Problem-Solving,  Growth Mindset, Ownership, Leadership

**Industry Terms:**

* Fintech, Financial Services,  Outage Tracking,  Workflow Monitoring,  SEV (Severity Event),  Reliability Engineering

**Company Values & Culture:**

* Democratizing Finance,  Curiosity, Growth-Minded,  Collaboration, Innovation, Customer-Centric, Mission-Driven, Inclusivity

**Action Verbs:**

* Design, Implement, Optimize, Improve, Ensure, Act, Lead, Collaborate, Build, Maintain, Track, Monitor, Identify, Remediate 

**Prioritization and Relevance:**

* **Frequency and Emphasis:**  Distributed Systems, High Availability, Low Latency, Scalability,  Python, Go, AWS, Kubernetes 
* **Essential vs. Preferred Qualifications:** Experience with Python/Django/Go and AWS are listed as "pluses", indicating they are preferred but not mandatory.  

**Resume Optimization Tip:**

Use the extracted keywords and phrases naturally throughout your resume, focusing on your accomplishments and quantifiable results. Highlight your experience with the specific technologies and methodologies mentioned in the job description to demonstrate your suitability for the role.

If you find the GitHub repository link, simply remove the repository name from the link to make it a GitHub profile link as it will contain the "username". Use that as the GitHub link.

**How to Use the Tool:** - Start by querying the tool with a broad question to gather a complete overview of the Applicant's educational background. If initial results are missing specific details, refine your queries to target these areas.
**Initial Query:** - "question": "What are all the educational qualifications, academic degrees, and related honors or distinctions obtained by the Applicant?"
**Refined Query (if needed):** - If the initial query does not return complete details (such as the name of the institution, degree specifics, GPA, etc.), run additional targeted queries for each missing element. For example:
  - "question": "What is the GPA and graduation year for the Applicant's Bachelor degree?"
  - "question": "List any academic honors or distinctions received by the Applicant during their university education."

For the "Honors/Distinctions" field, Do not get confused with non-academic honors like "Employee of the Month" or "Best Team Player". Only include academic honors like "Summa Cum Laude" or "Dean's List" if available.

# Personal Details
This section contains the contact information of the Applicant.

```
name: Saif Mahmud
saifmahmud.dev | linkedin.com/in/vmsaif
msaifofficial@gmail.com | 204 955 5064 | Winnipeg, MB
```

A unique self-made philosophy has always guided my journey in software development: to
create a "magic button" for users. That is, One button should do everything the user wants at this moment. Though this is not possible yet given our technological limitations, I have always believed, that programs should be as simple as that. 

This concept is not just about simplifying interactions but
about deeply understanding the user's needs and crafting solutions that feel intuitive,
empowering, and, above all, magical. It's about creating experiences where complex processes
vanish behind a single, seamless action. One button that will do everything the user is thinking
at the moment. Though this is not possible yet, I have written every single code line while
keeping this philosophy in my mind.

agent=Cross-Match Evaluator with Job Description
2024-07-07 10:19:30: task=Analyze and compare the keywords from a job description (Source 1) to the skills listed in the applicant's profile (Source 2). Ensure that partial matches are functionally or contextually related to the job requirements.
**Task Instructions**:
1. **Sources for Comparison**:
   - **Source 1**: Job Description Keywords.
   - **Source 2**: A JSON Object "combined skills list of applicant" containing the applicant's skills and technologies.

2. **Use of Tool**: It will search the internet. Use the tool to search for unfamiliar skills or technologies to understand their relevance to the job description.
  - Example of an unfamiliar skill: "Langchain". To use the tool,
  query: str = Field(description="What is Langchain, what is it's comparable tools, technology?")
  
3. **Evaluation Criteria**:
    - **Exact Match**: Direct correspondence between the job description and the applicantâ€™s qualifications. 
    
    - **Partial Match**: Skills that are not exactly the same but share similar applications or functionalities as those required by the job. The Job Description Section contains a "Partial_Match" field. Try to match the applicant's skills with the job description's Partial_Match field 
    
    - **missing_from_the_applicant_skills**: Skills that do not align with the job description. Your goal should be to move as many skills as possible from this section to the "Partial Match" after researching their relevance by using the tool. 

   The partial match section has 2 fields per object: 
    - "Skill Name": The skill mentioned in the job description.
    - "Relevance": The relevance of the applicant's with the job description's skill.

4. **Categorization**:
   - Organize skills into categories such as Programming Languages, Soft Skills, AI Frameworks, etc., based on the job description's requirements. Feel free to create category names as you see fit.

   - Aim for a balanced overview by listing 3-5 skills combining exact and partial matches for all categories.

5. **Structured Report**:
   - Generate a JSON report with 'Exact Match' and 'Partial Match' sections, specifying the job-related skill and its relevance to the applicant's skills.

Job Description Starts:
## BambooHR Recruiter Job Description Keyword and Phrase Extraction:

**Introduction:**

* **Role:** Recruiter
* **Company:** BambooHR 
* **Location:**  Not specified (potentially remote, indicating flexibility)
* **Industry:** HR Software, SaaS, Human Resources, Technology 

**Keyword Categorization:**

* **Essential Skills:**
    * **Hard Skills:** Recruiting, Sourcing, Screening, Interviewing (Phone & Video), Applicant Tracking System (ATS) Management, Recruitment Strategy Development & Execution 
    * **Soft Skills:** Communication, Interpersonal Skills, Teamwork, Independent Work Ethic, Passion, Proven Ability to Attract Top Talent 
* **Industry Terms:**  Human Resources (HR), SaaS, Employee Experience, Compliance Risk, Business Outcomes, Applicant Tracking System (ATS), Recruitment Process
* **Company Values & Culture:**  Mission-driven, People-centric, Streamlining, Automation, Improving Employee Experience, Passionate, Global Team 
* **Action Verbs:** Source, Screen, Conduct, Manage, Develop, Execute, Work Closely, Understand, Provide, Attract, Improve, Reduce, Drive

**Company Culture & Values:**

BambooHR emphasizes a **people-centric culture**, driven by the **mission to make work life better**. They value **passion, teamwork,** and a **global perspective**.  They are **innovation-focused**, believing in the power of **technology (SaaS, automation) to streamline HR processes** and improve the overall employee experience. 

**What BambooHR is Looking For:** 

They are seeking an **experienced Recruiter** with a proven track record of **attracting top talent**. The ideal candidate is **passionate** about HR, possesses **strong communication and interpersonal skills**, and thrives in a **fast-paced environment**.  They must be comfortable working both **independently and as part of a team.**

**What a Candidate Can Expect:**

Employees enjoy **comprehensive benefits**, including **medical, dental, and vision insurance**, a **401(k) with company match**, and **generous paid time off**.  The company also fosters a **positive work-life balance** with perks like **employee discounts** and **free snacks and drinks**.

* **Frequency and Emphasis:**  "Passion" and "experience" are repeatedly emphasized, suggesting these are highly valued qualities.
* **Essential vs. Preferred Qualifications:**  While a Bachelor's degree is listed, it doesn't specify "required," potentially indicating flexibility for the right candidate with significant experience. 

**Resume Optimization Tips:**

* **Use keywords throughout your resume**, especially in the summary and work experience sections.
* **Quantify your accomplishments** using numbers and metrics to demonstrate your impact in previous roles.

# Personal Details
This section contains the contact information of the Applicant.

```
name: Saif Mahmud
saifmahmud.dev | linkedin.com/in/vmsaif
msaifofficial@gmail.com | 204 955 5064 | Winnipeg, MB
```

A unique self-made philosophy has always guided my journey in software development: to
create a "magic button" for users. That is, One button should do everything the user wants at this moment. Though this is not possible yet given our technological limitations, I have always believed, that programs should be as simple as that. 

This concept is not just about simplifying interactions but
about deeply understanding the user's needs and crafting solutions that feel intuitive,
empowering, and, above all, magical. It's about creating experiences where complex processes
vanish behind a single, seamless action. One button that will do everything the user is thinking
at the moment. Though this is not possible yet, I have written every single code line while
keeping this philosophy in my mind.

**Guidelines:**
  - **Relevance:** Integrate keywords that are relevant to the described experience.
  - **Natural Language:** Weave keywords into the narrative seamlessly; they should enhance rather than disrupt the flow.
  - **Conciseness and Clarity:** 
    -- Limit the short description to 10-15 words, focusing on a concise summary of the experience. Make sure it is not redundant with the key highlights below.
    -- Keep up-to 3 best key highlights for each experience, focusing on the most impactful achievements or skills.
    -- Employ powerful action verbs and succinct phrases to convey significant achievements in approximately 10-20 words per key highlight. If possible, split one entry into multiple key highlights to keep them concise.
  - **Contextual Accuracy:** Choose keywords that accurately reflect the skills and responsibilities in the experience. Avoid using keywords that misrepresent the applicant's role or contributions.
  - you are also provided a list of "missing_from_the_applicant_skills" which are in the job description but not in the applicant's experiences. Try to weave some of these words where they fit naturally.
  - **Avoid Keyword Overload:** Maintain a balanced use of keywords to ensure natural readability and effectiveness of the description.

**Job Description Keywords:** ## BambooHR Recruiter Job Description Keyword and Phrase Extraction:

They are seeking an **experienced Recruiter** with a proven track record of **attracting top talent**. **About BambooHR:**

BambooHR aims to enhance work life by automating HR processes, enabling HR teams to focus on their employees. Trusted by over 10,000 HR teams globally, BambooHR seeks to improve employee experiences, minimize compliance risks, and drive positive business outcomes.

**Job Description:**

The Recruiter will play a crucial role in the recruitment process from sourcing to hiring candidates. Responsibilities include:

* Identifying and screening candidates for vacant positions
* Conducting phone and video interviews
* Managing the applicant tracking system
* Developing and implementing recruitment strategies
* Collaborating with hiring managers to determine their requirements
* Providing support to hiring teams

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business, or a similar field

* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities
* Capability to work independently and as part of a team

# Personal Details
This section contains the contact information of the Applicant.

```
name: Saif Mahmud
saifmahmud.dev | linkedin.com/in/vmsaif
msaifofficial@gmail.com | 204 955 5064 | Winnipeg, MB
```

A unique self-made philosophy has always guided my journey in software development: to
create a "magic button" for users. That is, One button should do everything the user wants at this moment. Though this is not possible yet given our technological limitations, I have always believed, that programs should be as simple as that. 

This concept is not just about simplifying interactions but
about deeply understanding the user's needs and crafting solutions that feel intuitive,
empowering, and, above all, magical. It's about creating experiences where complex processes
vanish behind a single, seamless action. One button that will do everything the user is thinking
at the moment. Though this is not possible yet, I have written every single code line while
keeping this philosophy in my mind.

In your input context, some tasks will not have any data or say provided context does not have any data, you should ignore those tasks and not include them in the final output. Only look at the data you have found in the context.
The final output **must not contain** any pair which has "key" = null values. You should only include pairs that have values. Remove any pair that has a null value.

agent=Cross-Match Evaluator with Job Description
2024-07-07 10:45:36: task=Analyze and compare the keywords from a job description (Source 1) to the skills listed in the applicant's profile (Source 2). Ensure that partial matches are functionally or contextually related to the job requirements.
**Task Instructions**:
1. **Sources for Comparison**:
   - **Source 1**: Job Description Keywords.
   - **Source 2**: A JSON Object "combined skills list of applicant" containing the applicant's skills and technologies.

2. **Use of Tool**: It will search the internet. Use the tool to search for unfamiliar skills or technologies to understand their relevance to the job description.
  - Example of an unfamiliar skill: "Langchain". To use the tool,
  query: str = Field(description="What is Langchain, what is it's comparable tools, technology?")
  
3. **Evaluation Criteria**:
    - **Exact Match**: Direct correspondence between the job description and the applicantâ€™s qualifications. 
    
    - **Partial Match**: Skills that are not exactly the same but share similar applications or functionalities as those required by the job. The Job Description Section contains a "Partial_Match" field. Try to match the applicant's skills with the job description's Partial_Match field 
    
    - **missing_from_the_applicant_skills**: Skills that do not align with the job description. Your goal should be to move as many skills as possible from this section to the "Partial Match" after researching their relevance by using the tool. 

   The partial match section has 2 fields per object: 
    - "Skill Name": The skill mentioned in the job description.
    - "Relevance": The relevance of the applicant's with the job description's skill.

4. **Categorization**:
   - Organize skills into categories such as Programming Languages, Soft Skills, AI Frameworks, etc., based on the job description's requirements. Feel free to create category names as you see fit.

   - Aim for a balanced overview by listing 3-5 skills combining exact and partial matches for all categories.

5. **Structured Report**:
   - Generate a JSON report with 'Exact Match' and 'Partial Match' sections, specifying the job-related skill and its relevance to the applicant's skills.

Job Description Starts:
## Keyword and Phrase Extraction for Resume Optimization: Talent Acquisition Partner at BambooHR

**Introduction:**

* **Role:** Talent Acquisition Partner
* **Company:** BambooHR
* **Location:** Utah, United States
* **Industry:** Human Resources Technology (HR Tech), Software as a Service (SaaS)

**Company Culture and Values:**

BambooHR emphasizes **modern** and **innovative** solutions, aiming to make HR **easy and accessible**. They value **growth**, evident in their rapid expansion.  As a company, they highlight teamwork ("Work with other members... to achieve our goals").  Candidates should portray alignment with these values and a passion for simplifying HR processes. BambooHR offers the opportunity to join a leading platform in a rapidly growing industry.

**What BambooHR is looking for:**

 BambooHR seeks a **passionate** talent acquisition professional with a strong understanding of the **full life cycle of talent acquisition**. They value experience in developing and implementing **recruiting strategies**, excellent communication, and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively. The ideal candidate will be **up-to-date on the latest recruiting trends and technologies**.

**What the candidate can expect:**

This role offers the chance to make a significant impact in a **fast-paced, collaborative environment**.  The Talent Acquisition Partner will play a key role in attracting and onboarding top talent, contributing directly to BambooHR's continued growth and success. 

**Keyword Categorization:**

**Essential Skills:**

* **Hard Skills:** Talent Acquisition, Full Life Cycle Recruiting, Sourcing, Screening, Interviewing, Onboarding, Recruiting Strategies, Hiring Processes, Recruiting Trends, Recruiting Technologies
* **Soft Skills:** Communication, Interpersonal Skills, Teamwork, Independent Work, Passion, Problem-Solving, Decision-Making

**Industry Terms:**

* Human Resources (HR)
* Talent Acquisition
* HR Technology (HR Tech)
* Software as a Service (SaaS)
* Applicant Tracking System (ATS)
* Recruiting Metrics
* Employer Branding

**Company Values & Culture:**

* Modern
* Innovative
* Easy
* Accessible
* Growth
* Passion
* Teamwork

**Action Verbs:**

* Partner
* Develop
* Implement
* Source
* Screen
* Conduct
* Onboard
* Ensure
* Stay up-to-date
* Work

* **Frequency and Emphasis:**  "Talent Acquisition," "Recruiting Strategies," "Full Life Cycle," "Passion," "Growth" are frequently used and indicate key focus areas.
* **Essential vs. Preferred Qualifications:** While a Bachelor's degree is listed, equivalent experience might be considered. Focus on highlighting the 3+ years of experience and tangible achievements in previous roles.

**Selection Criteria**:
1. **Most Recent Experience:** Always include the most recent relevant experience, unless it is completely unrelated or significantly outdated as of today (July 07, 2024). 2. **Relevance to Job Description:** Thoroughly assess each experience based on:
  - **Keywords and Phrases:** Ensure experiences include specific keywords or phrases from the job description.

  - **Skills:** Choose experiences that demonstrate the skills explicitly required for the job.
3. **Balanced Selection:** After including the most recent experience, select two additional experiences that best meet the job requirements. Aim to maintain a balance between work and project experiences, based solely on relevance.

Applicant Info Organized Data:
# Personal Details
This section contains the contact information of the Applicant.

```
name: Saif Mahmud
saifmahmud.dev | linkedin.com/in/vmsaif
msaifofficial@gmail.com | 204 955 5064 | Winnipeg, MB
```

A unique self-made philosophy has always guided my journey in software development: to
create a "magic button" for users. That is, One button should do everything the user wants at this moment. Though this is not possible yet given our technological limitations, I have always believed, that programs should be as simple as that. 

This concept is not just about simplifying interactions but
about deeply understanding the user's needs and crafting solutions that feel intuitive,
empowering, and, above all, magical. It's about creating experiences where complex processes
vanish behind a single, seamless action. One button that will do everything the user is thinking
at the moment. Though this is not possible yet, I have written every single code line while
keeping this philosophy in my mind.

## ATS Pass AI 
Multiagent | AI | Python | RAG Search | Resume Automation Tool - January 2024 - Present

- Utilized advanced AI models and multi-agent technologies to dynamically personalize resumes, demonstrating cutting-edge technical and analytical capabilities.
- Engineered a system that extracts user data and analyzes job descriptions with advanced AI tools like Gemini Pro and RAG Search, achieving over 85% keyword alignment and optimizing resumes for ATS.
- Developed scalable architecture to anticipate future needs and adaptations, showcasing foresight and a commitment to innovation.
- Project repository available on GitHub: [https://github.com/vmsaif/ats-pass-ai](https://github.com/vmsaif/ats-pass-ai).

  - **Natural Language:** Weave keywords into the narrative seamlessly; they should enhance rather than disrupt the flow.

    -- Limit the short description to 10-15 words, focusing on a concise summary of the experience. Make sure it is not redundant with the key highlights below.
    -- Keep up-to 3 best key highlights for each experience, focusing on the most impactful achievements or skills.

**Job Description Keywords:** ## Keyword and Phrase Extraction for Resume Optimization: Talent Acquisition Partner at BambooHR

**Introduction:**

* **Role:** Talent Acquisition Partner
* **Company:** BambooHR
* **Location:** Utah, United States
* **Industry:** Human Resources Technology (HR Tech), Software as a Service (SaaS)

**Company Culture and Values:**

BambooHR emphasizes **modern** and **innovative** solutions, aiming to make HR **easy and accessible**. They value **growth**, evident in their rapid expansion.  As a company, they highlight teamwork ("Work with other members... to achieve our goals").  Candidates should portray alignment with these values and a passion for simplifying HR processes. BambooHR offers the opportunity to join a leading platform in a rapidly growing industry.

**What BambooHR is looking for:**

 BambooHR seeks a **passionate** talent acquisition professional with a strong understanding of the **full life cycle of talent acquisition**. They value experience in developing and implementing **recruiting strategies**, excellent communication, and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively. The ideal candidate will be **up-to-date on the latest recruiting trends and technologies**.

**What the candidate can expect:**

This role offers the chance to make a significant impact in a **fast-paced, collaborative environment**.  The Talent Acquisition Partner will play a key role in attracting and onboarding top talent, contributing directly to BambooHR's continued growth and success. 

**Keyword Categorization:**

* **Hard Skills:** Talent Acquisition, Full Life Cycle Recruiting, Sourcing, Screening, Interviewing, Onboarding, Recruiting Strategies, Hiring Processes, Recruiting Trends, Recruiting Technologies

Company Value Extraction:
**Talent Acquisition Partner**

**BambooHR**

**Location:** Utah, United States

**Industry:** Human Resources Technology

**Company Overview:**

BambooHR is a modern and innovative HR platform designed to simplify HR processes for small and medium-sized businesses. The company's mission is to make HR accessible and easy to manage. BambooHR has experienced rapid growth and is now a leading HR platform globally.

**Job Description:**

Reporting to the Talent Acquisition team, the Talent Acquisition Partner is responsible for managing the entire talent acquisition lifecycle, from sourcing and screening to interviewing and onboarding new employees. Collaborating closely with hiring managers, the ideal candidate will identify and attract top talent, develop and implement effective recruiting strategies, and ensure the successful integration of new hires into the organization.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Partner with hiring managers to determine talent requirements and develop sourcing strategies
* Utilize various sourcing channels to identify and engage potential candidates
* Screen and evaluate candidates through multiple assessment methods
* Conduct structured interviews and make data-driven hiring decisions
* Onboard new hires and provide support during their transition
* Monitor and analyze recruiting performance to identify areas for improvement
* Stay abreast of industry best practices and emerging technologies

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business, or a related field
* Minimum of 3 years of progressive experience in talent acquisition
* Proven expertise in all aspects of the recruiting process
* Strong understanding of recruitment strategies, candidate assessment techniques, and interview methodologies
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Passion for talent acquisition and a drive to deliver exceptional hiring results

**To Apply:**

Interested candidates are encouraged to submit their resume and cover letter to [email protected] Please highlight your relevant experience, skills, and how your passion for talent acquisition aligns with BambooHR's mission.2024-07-07 10:47:57: status=started

2024-07-07 19:19:05: task=You are given a tool that retrieves info simply by asking questions as a list of strings. Use the tool to extract comprehensive personal details.
How you should use the tool: argument: "question": "Give me Personal Details about the applicant"
The tool will return a large chunk of information. look "deeply" into the chunk to find your data. If you did not find a field, ask the tool again with the missing field. for example, if you didn't find the GitHub, ask the tool "Do the applicant have GitHub?" to get the GitHub link.
This is what the GitHub profile link looks like: https://github.com/username This is what the GitHub repository link looks like: https://github.com/username/repository_name
If you find the GitHub repository link, simply remove the repository name from the link to make it a GitHub profile link as it will contain the "username". Use that as the GitHub link.

2024-07-07 19:19:11: task=Utilize a semantic search tool to extract detailed education information about the Applicant. Formulate specific queries to retrieve comprehensive details about their academic history, including institutions, qualifications, and achievements. There may be multiple degrees or educational experiences to consider.
**How to Use the Tool:** - Start by querying the tool with a broad question to gather a complete overview of the Applicant's educational background. If initial results are missing specific details, refine your queries to target these areas.
**Initial Query:** - "question": "What are all the educational qualifications, academic degrees, and related honors or distinctions obtained by the Applicant?"
**Refined Query (if needed):** - If the initial query does not return complete details (such as the name of the institution, degree specifics, GPA, etc.), run additional targeted queries for each missing element. For example:
  - "question": "What is the GPA and graduation year for the Applicant's Bachelor degree?"
  - "question": "List any academic honors or distinctions received by the Applicant during their university education."

For the "Honors/Distinctions" field, Do not get confused with non-academic honors like "Employee of the Month" or "Best Team Player". Only include academic honors like "Summa Cum Laude" or "Dean's List" if available.

SAFIUR MAHDI
Software Developer
Skip The Dishes
204-583-3432 | Winnipeg, MB

A unique self-made philosophy has always guided my journey in software development: to
create a "magic button" for users. That is, One button should do everything the user wants at this moment. Though this is not possible yet given our technological limitations, I have always believed, that programs should be as simple as that. 

This concept is not just about simplifying interactions but
about deeply understanding the user's needs and crafting solutions that feel intuitive,
empowering, and, above all, magical. It's about creating experiences where complex processes
vanish behind a single, seamless action. One button that will do everything the user is thinking
at the moment. Though this is not possible yet, I have written every single code line while
keeping this philosophy in my mind.

This is what the GitHub profile link looks like: https://github.com/username This is what the GitHub repository link looks like: https://github.com/username/repository_name
If you find the GitHub repository link, simply remove the repository name from the link to make it a GitHub profile link as it will contain the "username". Use that as the GitHub link.

# Summary 
This section contains a summary of the applicant's career goals, approach to Software Development and a brief description of their software development philosophy.

A unique self-made philosophy has always guided my journey in software development: to
create a "magic button" for users. That is, One button should do everything the user wants at this moment. Though this is not possible yet given our technological limitations, I have always believed, that programs should be as simple as that. 

This concept is not just about simplifying interactions but
about deeply understanding the user's needs and crafting solutions that feel intuitive,
empowering, and, above all, magical. It's about creating experiences where complex processes
vanish behind a single, seamless action. One button that will do everything the user is thinking
at the moment. Though this is not possible yet, I have written every single code line while
keeping this philosophy in my mind.

# Summary 
This section contains a summary of the applicant's career goals, approach to Software Development and a brief description of their software development philosophy.

A unique self-made philosophy has always guided my journey in software development: to
create a "magic button" for users. That is, One button should do everything the user wants at this moment. Though this is not possible yet given our technological limitations, I have always believed, that programs should be as simple as that. 

This concept is not just about simplifying interactions but
about deeply understanding the user's needs and crafting solutions that feel intuitive,
empowering, and, above all, magical. It's about creating experiences where complex processes
vanish behind a single, seamless action. One button that will do everything the user is thinking
at the moment. Though this is not possible yet, I have written every single code line while
keeping this philosophy in my mind.

tech industry to drive innovation and efficiency. I seek to
contribute to teams where continuous improvement and
